thread.title: Lucky 7: These Stock Market Leaders Have Top Dividend Growth Rates
thread.title_full: Lucky 7: These Stock Market Leaders Have Top Dividend Growth Rates

title: Lucky 7: These Stock Market Leaders Have Top Dividend Growth Rates
text:
Small Bank Stocks Beating Citigroup, Other Big Banks 
Few stocks made new highs Tuesday as the overall market rebounded from the prior session's steep declines. But a couple of regional banks made the cut. First Connecticut Bancorp (NASDAQ:FBNK) rose to a 20-month intraday high and is within the 5% buy zone from a 16.34 cup-with-handle buy point. The ... 08/25/2015 06:03 PM ET Brocade Earnings Encourage Investors; Shares Rise 
Brocade Communications Systems (NASDAQ:BRCD) stock got some new life Friday, gapping up as much as 16% at one point, as investors were encouraged by better-than-expected earnings and sales from the provider of storage area networks. Shares retreated somewhat later, but Brocade stock was still up 8% ... 08/21/2015 04:13 PM ET Nasdaq Tanks 2%; S&P 500 And Dow Down For The Year 
Stocks stretched losses Thursday afternoon and were near session lows amid uncertainty regarding a Fed rate hike in September and a fresh slate of economic data. The Nasdaq led the way down with a 2.3% plunge. The S&P 500 fell 1.5% and sliced through its 200-day moving average. The Dow Jones ... 08/20/2015 01:50 PM ET Is the Death Knell Sounding For Foreclosures? 
In the latest in a flurry of good news for the housing market, foreclosure starts slid close to a decade low in July as banks cleared out old distressed properties while tightened lending standards have helped curb the number of new ones coming in the market. A total of 45,381 U.S. properties ... 08/20/2015 12:01 AM ET Tech Stocks Traded Most Today: Sprint, Apple And ... 
Solar company SunEdison (NYSE:SUNE), Sprint (NYSE:S) and Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) made up the market's most active tech stocks Tuesday. Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU) and Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO) also moved in high volume, as didMicrosoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) and Facebook (NASDAQ:FB), with the latter up more ... 08/18/2015 07:09 PM ET Should You Sell Dividend Stock Plays In A Market Crash? 
From May 19 to "World Black Monday" on Aug. 24, the Dow Jones industrials dropped 2,981 points, or 16%. If you invest in income stocks, what should you do in a decline like that? If you've held a super-steady stock a long time and your capital gain far exceeds the size of that "black and blue" ... 08/27/2015 05:01 PM ET Trash Hauler Waste Management Hanging Tough In Market Correction 
In a correction, just about all stocks will go down with the general market. But some will hold up well in the face of market weakness. One is Waste Management (NYSE:WM). Since the market started unraveling more than a week ago, Waste Management has pulled back 8%, while the S&P 500 has fallen as ... 08/26/2015 05:32 PM ET These 14 S&P 500 Components Have Solid Yields 
In the aftermath of "World Black Monday," how are the best-quality dividend payers on the S&P 500 doing? Not terribly bad, actually. IBD wanted to see how many names within the 500 components of the key stock benchmark are flat or up for the year in price, produce a dividend yield of 1% or more, ... 08/25/2015 05:39 PM ET These Utility Stocks Are Bucking The Market Sell-Off 
In a true market sell-off, no sector survives. The 2008-early 2009 bear proved it. As the S&P 500 dropped almost 58% from its then 2007 peak, the Dow Jones utility average was hardly spared. It fell from a January 2008 high of 557.69 to a March 2009 low of 287.29, a 48% plunge. Last week's ... 08/24/2015 04:26 PM ET This Dividend Leader Is An Ancillary Housing Play 
Homebuilders have been a nice pocket of leadership in the market in recent days, but they've come under pressure like most other stocks. Ancillary plays to capitalize on housing market strength aren't hard to find, but there's only one that gets Dividend Leader status. Leggett & Platt ... 08/21/2015 04:12 PM ET
